intro: Senecio oligolepis, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Senecio oligolepis is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
